Economics.question: Please give formula for CROSS RATES with bid-ask spreads
Please give formula for LABOR PRODUCTIVITY (output per worker)

Corporate Finance.question: Categories of capital budgeting projects
answer:
1. Replacement projects to maintain the business
  2. Replacement projects for cost reduction
  3. Expansion projects
  4. New products or market
  5. Mandatory projects
  6. Other projects (e.g., R&D projects)

Corporate Finance.question: Principles of Capital budgeting
answer: <ol>
• Decisions are based on cash flows, not accounting income (incremental cash flows)
• Cash flows are based on opportunity cost
• The timing of cash flows is important
• CF are analyzed on an after-tax basis
• Financing costs are reflected in the project's required rate of return

Corporate Finance.question: Enumerate depreciation methods and implication for the after-tax cash flows of a capital project
answer: <ol>
• Straight line. Used for financial reporting.
• $MARCS$ (modified accelerated cost recovery system). Used for TAX purposes. Assets are classified into $3-,5-,7-,10-$year classes

Corporate Finance.question: What is depreciation basis in $MACRS$
answer: Depreciation basis $=$ purchase price $+$ + shipping or handling cost $+$ installation cost

Corporate Finance.question: NPV of the investment
answer: $$ NPV = \sum_{t=1}^{\infty} \frac{TI_t}{(1+r_e)^t} $$

Corporate Finance.question: Initial investment outlay
answer: $$ outlay = FCInv + NWCInv $$

Corporate Finance.question: Definition of NWCInv
answer: $$NWCInv = \Delta \text{non-cash current assets} + \Delta \text{non-cash current liabilities} = \Delta NWC$$

Corporate Finance.question: Definition After-tax operating CF
answer: are incremental cash flows over the capital asset's economic life. $$CF = (S-C-D)(1-T) + D$$

Corporate Finance.question: Definition of Terminal year after-tax non-operating CF ($TNOCF$)
answer: $$TNOCF = SAL_T + NWCInv - T (SAL_T - B_T)$$

where:
$Sal_T$ = pre-tax cash proceeds from sale of fixed capital
$B_T$ = book value of the fixed capital sold

Corporate Finance.question: Initial investment outlay for replacement project
answer: $$ outlay = FCInv + NWCInv - Sal_0 + T(Sal_0 - B_0)$$

Corporate Finance.question: Definition After-tax operating CF in replacement project
answer: are incremental cash flows over the capital asset's economic life. $$\Delta CF = (\Delta S- \Delta C)(1-T) + \Delta DT$$

Corporate Finance.question: Definition of Terminal year after-tax non-operating CF ($TNOCF$) in replacement project
answer: $$TNOCF = Sal_{TNew} - sal_{TOld} + NWCInv - T (SAL_TNew - B_TNew) - (SAL_TOld - B_TOld)$$

where:
$Sal_T$ = pre-tax cash proceeds from sale of fixed capital
$B_T$ = book value of the fixed capital sold

Corporate Finance.question: Target payout ratio adjustment model
answer: $$ \text{expected dividend} = PD + (E[\Delta EPS] \cdot TPR \cdot AF) $$

where:
$AF$ - adjustment factor = 1 / number of years over which the adjustment in dividends will take place
$TPR$ - target payout ratio
Used when company earnings are expected to increase and the current payut ratio is below the target

Corporate Finance.question: Target payout ratio adjustment model
answer: $$ \text{expected dividend} = PD + (E[\Delta EPS] \cdot TPR \cdot AF) $$

where:
$AF$ - adjustment factor = 1 / number of years over which the adjustment in dividends will take place
$TPR$ - target payout ratio
Used when company earnings are expected to increase and the current payut ratio is below the target

Corporate Finance.question: MM model II (no taxes) with leverage
answer: As leverage increases, the cost of equity increases, but $WACC$ and the cost of debt are unchanged

Corporate Finance.question: MM model I (with taxes), value is maximized at 100% debt
answer: $$ V_L = V_U + (t \cdot d)$$

Corporate Finance.question: According to tatic trade-off theory, value of a levered firm is:
answer: $$ V_L = V_U + (t \cdot d) - PV (\text{costs of financial distress})$$

Corporate Finance.question: Formula for economic profit
answer: $$ EP = NOPAT - $WACC = EBIT(1-\text{tax rate}) - WACC \cdot capital$$
